Custom data types¶

Documented here are the custom data types implemented by isopy for working with and manipulating different types of data. See the Tutorial for examples on using these data types.

IsopyStrings¶

MassString(string)

String representation of an integer representing a mass number.

ElementString(string)

String representation of an element symbol.

IsotopeString(string)

String representation of an isotope containing a mass number followed by an element symbol.

RatioString(string)

String representation of a ratio consisting of a numerator and a denominator.

string(item)

Create an IsopyString from the input.

IsopyLists¶

MassList(items[, skip_duplicates, …])

A list consisting exclusively of MassString items.

ElementList(items[, skip_duplicates, …])

A list consisting exclusively of ElementString items.

IsotopeList(items[, skip_duplicates, …])

A list consisting exclusively of IsotopeString items.

RatioList(items[, skip_duplicates, …])

A list consisting exclusively of RatioString items.

list_(items[, skip_duplicates, allow_duplicates])

Create an IsopyList from the input.

aslist(items[, skip_duplicates, …])

Convert the input to a IsopyList.

IsopyArrays¶

MassArray

An array where data is stored in rows and columns with Masstring keys.

ElementArray

An array where data is stored in rows and columns with ElementString keys.

IsotopeArray

An array where data is stored in rows and columns with IsotopeString keys.

RatioArray

An array where data is stored in rows and columns with RatioString keys.

array([values, keys, ndim, dtype])

Create an IsopyArray from the input.

asarray([values, keys, ndim, dtype])

Convert the input to a IsopyArray.

asanyarray([values, dtype])

Convert the input to a IsopyArray or an numpy.ndarray`.

IsopyDicts¶

ReferenceDict([dictionary])

Custom dictionary where every item stores a single value as float64 with an IsopyString key.
